CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 4, 1951, pg. 2, reads: "Beltzhoover Residents Protest Clogged Sewers - After repeated calls on the City's Department of Highways and Sewers to do something about the numerous clogged street sewers in Beltzhoover area where drain water is said to be backing up into some homes and businesses, this group of residents decided Tuesday to do something about the situation themselves. Here under the leadership of Paul Cralle, dairy store manager, they begin to dig into debris in one of the five sewers clogged in one block, bounded by Gearing.  Sylvania, Montooth and Chalfont Streets.  The Rev. C. L. Butcher of St. Paul AME Church and the Rev. W. R. Harris of Beulah Baptist Church have also complained. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of women and men, including Doll Stevens, George Mason, Cora Green, Mary Johnson, Fred Stevens, Alvin Green, Leonard Johnson with shovel, Leon Paul Cralle squatting on right, children including Susie Cralle, Paul Cralle Jr., and possibly Charmette James, and dog, gathered around clogged sewer on Gearing Street, Beltzhoover
